data.title: Operating Partners Forum
data.meta_description: Join an elite crowd of operating partner value creators in PE & VC portfolio operations for a day of conversations on transformation, innovation and more...
data.text:
Chioma Achebe is a Principal in Private Equity and is based in Washington, DC.

As part of the Global Portfolio Solutions team, Chioma leads value creation initiatives across the portfolio, and provides strategic and operational support to investment teams and Carlyle companies. Prior to Carlyle, Chioma was at the Boston Consulting Group, where she focused on large-scale transformations across a range of industries.

Chioma received her MBA from Harvard Business School, JD from Harvard Law School, and BA with honors in economics from Harvard College. She is a member of the New York Bar and serves on the Board of the Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia.

Lisa joined Norwest in 2020, first as a part-time Senior Advisor, then full-time as a marketing operating executive. She also served as the firm’s CMO from 2022-2024, driving the reimagination of the Norwest brand during that time and enhancing the firm’s foundation as a thought leader and community builder. As a member of the portfolio services team, Lisa lends her 20+ years of B2B marketing experience to the portfolio, working shoulder-to-shoulder with company leaders to help them optimize and scale their revenue engines for growth.

Prior to joining Norwest, Lisa was VP of Marketing at Lucidworks, where she built the growth function from the ground up. Before that, she held leadership roles at VC-backed B2B SaaS companies, including Demandbase and Castlight Health. While at Demandbase, Lisa became a certified Account-Based Marketing expert and frequent speaker on ABM best practices in her role as VP of Demand Generation & Brand.

Lisa holds a bachelor of arts degree in sociology from Stanford University.

Norwest is a leading venture and growth equity investment firm that works side-by-side with the world’s top entrepreneurs, empowering them throughout their personal journey of professional growth. Managing more than $15.5 billion in capital, we have invested in over 700 early-to-late-stage companies, with more than 230 currently active. Focused primarily on consumer, enterprise, and healthcare, we provide businesses with the specialized resources, expertise, guidance, and connections to achieve their vision. Norwest has offices in Menlo Park and San Francisco, with subsidiaries in India and Israel. To learn more, visit nvp.com.

Hannah is President, CEO and owner of Resilere Partners (formerly The LAKPR Group). A deeply experienced communications strategist and C-suite advisor, she specializes in working with private equity firms and their portfolio companies – partnering with leaders and organizations at critical inflection points to effectively execute transformation agendas, amplify brands, navigate periods of challenge and accelerate the paths to value creation.

Named “among the best in the business when it comes to crisis communications,” she has managed scores of high-profile crisis situations and spoken on numerous related topics. Fun fact: she created and authored the historical introduction to The Twinkies Cookbook on behalf of Hostess Brands, for whom she also helped conceive and lead “the sweetest comeback in the history of ever” following the acquisition of the brands by Apollo Global Management and C. Dean Metropoulos & Co.

Prior to becoming President, CEO and owner of The LAKPR Group, which re-branded to Resilere Partners in 2024, Hannah was a Principal at LAK Public Relations, which she joined in 1999. In 2020, she executed an acquisition of assets to establish a new firm.

She began her communications career serving as Press Secretary to New York State Senator Roy M. Goodman, the Senate Committee on Investigations, Taxation and Government Operations, and the Senate Special Committee on Arts and Cultural Affairs.

Resilere Partners (formerly The LAKPR Group) is a strategic communications and advisory firm focused on partnering with leaders and organizations during periods of transformation and high-stakes inflection points. The firm has extensive experience partnering with private equity firms and their portfolio companies to deploy communications as a critical lever to drive growth and transition journeys at the heart of the investment thesis and accelerate the path to value creation.

With specialized offerings spanning the entire investment lifecycle, Resilere Partners serves as trusted advisors, working with urgency to navigate complex organizational dynamics, augment leaders’ strengths, build crucial alignment, inspire cultures of engagement and performance, and elevate and define brands through the development and execution of internal, external and crisis communications strategies.

Nathaniel is a senior product manager at Andreessen Horowitz focused on building products that power the firm’s network and investments.

Prior to joining a16z, Nathaniel was co-founder and CEO of Knowhere, where he led a team that built generative machine learning models to analyze and generate trustworthy news content, serving several million subscribers in the US with daily national and local coverage. Before that, Nathaniel worked in investment banking and private equity at Deutsche Bank and Oakley Capital, where he focused on M&A, capital raises, and buyouts for technology, media, telecoms, and healthcare businesses.

Nathaniel was born and raised in London, and graduated with a combined honors degree in philosophy, politics and international relations, and economics from Durham University in the UK. He is an avid skier, backpacker, off-roader, and student aviator, a keen reader of history and philosophy, and lifelong devotee of Arsenal Football Club. As a teenager, he was a nationally ranked track sprinter over 100 and 200m.

Alex Bello is a Director, Technology Strategy at EQT where he provides strategic support and advice to EQTs investment teams and portfolio companies with a focus on product, technology and cyber security. EQT is a purpose-driven global investment organization with $227 Billion AUM and almost three decades of developing companies across multiple geographies, sectors and strategies covering all phases of a business’ development, from start-up to maturity.

Prior to joining EQT, Alex served as the VP of Product at Armory, where he played a key role in bringing a product to market used to deliver software at scale by some of the worlds largest engineering teams. Notably, he was awarded a patent for continuous software deployment, solidifying his expertise in software delivery methodologies. Previously, Alex held a number of Engineering leadership roles including VP of Engineering at Lithium (acquired by Vista Equity Partners and rebranded as Khoros), During his tenure, Lithium grew its revenue 6x and scaled its digital platform to support over 100 million users across hundreds of leading brands globally.

With over 20 years of experience in product and technology leadership, Alex started his career as a Software Engineer. His core expertise lies in building large-scale, highly secure software and data platforms, focusing on scalable product foundations, optimal R&D organizational structures, and driving growth through experimentation and data-driven leadership.

Bhaskara is a dynamic digital entrepreneur and engineering leader with over 30 years of experience. He is known for his expertise in building and scaling digital product and solution engineering units. Through strategic roles as CTO and VP of Engineering, he has driven significant business value by leveraging innovative approaches like low-code/no-code, cloud-first, microservices, and DevSecOps. A passionate believer in Servant Leadership and an avid developer advocate, Bhaskara excels in fostering self-organizing cultures and innovative mentorship models. His dedication to integrating Agile and Kanban practices with modern tooling has effectively addressed entire product lifecycles.

Nagarro is a global digital engineering and consulting leader with a full-service offering. Harnessing the power of our Fluidic Enterprise vision and thinking breakthroughs framework, we help our clients become human-centric, digital-first organizations, augmenting their ability to be responsive, efficient, intimate, creative, and sustainable. Our client-centric, agile, responsible, intelligent, non-hierarchical, global values come together to form our CARING superpower, which denotes a humanistic, people-first way of thinking with a strong emphasis on ethics. Caring guides us as a global company. We have a broad and long-standing international customer base, primarily in Europe and North America. This includes many global blue-chip companies, leading independent software vendors (ISVs), other market and industry leaders, and public sector clients. At Nagarro, over 18,000 experts across 36 countries are helping our partners succeed today.

Fabian is a Director in Efficio’s North America region and our worldwide technology sector lead. He has worked with numerous Silicon Valley and Tech companies such as Genesys, UKG, McAfee, Zendesk and Qualtrics during his 15 years in consulting with Efficio and the Boston Consulting Group. His experience covers all levers to streamline costs from helping clients find the right partners for growth, to improving supplier management and achieving significant cost savings. Before his consulting career, Fabian completed his PhD in Theoretical Physics at the Delft University of Technology.

Efficio is the world’s largest independent procurement and supply chain consultancy.

We help organizations reduce costs, improve internal processes, and upskill their procurement teams, enabling them to become high-value-generating functions within their businesses. We support our PE clients both at a portfolio level and across the full transaction cycle: from pre-deal due diligence to post-acquisition value creation and exit support. Efficio has an unrivaled track record of delivering significant operational, EBITDA, and working capital benefits in private equity assets. So far, we have delivered results for over 50 private equity funds across North America and Europe.

While we are sector-agnostic, technology is our fastest-growing client sector. Fueled by our ability to work with a truly cross-functional mindset, we enable our clients to adapt their supply chain and supplier landscape to the evolving needs of fast-paced growth and reduce costs.

Eidji is a Partner in KPMG’s Deal Advisory & Strategy Practice and is the U.S. Working Capital Leader, based in Los Angeles. In this role he is responsible for serving the office of the CFO and assisting global Private Equity firms drive growth by focusing on their capital and transaction strategy and releasing cash tied up in portfolio companies across industries and geographies.

He has over 20+ years of cross-industry and consulting experience in 40+ countries, and has advised several Fortune 100 and 500 C-suites as an expert in leading large-scale strategy through operational execution programs. Eidji has unlocked over $10bn in high impact cash flow and working capital improvements, driven technology-enabled transformations, and executed value creation projects across the entire M&A lifecycle. His experience spans across Private Equity, Consumer & Retail, Technology/SaaS, Pharma & BioTech, Industrial Products, Oil & Gas, Automative and Aerospace & Defense. Prior to KPMG, Eidji held engineering and executive leadership roles at EY-Parthenon, PwC, Aston Martin, Jaguar Land Rover, Ford Motor Company and Starbucks.

KPMG is one of the world’s leading professional services firms. Our global organization of firms has more than 240,000 professionals serving clients in 145 countries and territories, providing innovative business methodologies and audit, tax and advisory services to many of the world’s largest and most prestigious organizations.

Our Private Equity practice is a fully integrated, cross-functional team of 1,500 professionals, including 250 partners, focused on serving private equity firms and their portfolio companies. Our experienced professionals understand the dynamic nature of the private equity marketplace and it’s enormous growth potential.

Our professionals bring passion and a fresh approach to the issues that challenge our private equity clients through their entire lifecycle, from structuring funds to realizing value.

Will focuses on holistic, sustainable transformation of private equity investments. Most recently serving as a Chief Transformation Officer and Interim Chief Supply Chain Officer for a private equity backed consumer company. In this role, he turned around a company to structurally positive cash flow in one year post close whilst standing up the operations out of a global carveout. He also served as a Managing Director and Partner at AlixPartners advising and serving in interim roles for large scale private equity investors focused on operational transformation.

Experience includes:

Served as an Interim COO for a Tech-enabled CPG company.

Carved out a $500m CPG company from a multi-national conglomerate; stood up independent operations within 12 months including 3PL and IT ecosystem.

Served various PE clients across numerous transformation situations as an advisor and interim operating executive.

Will holds an MBA from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, a Bachelor of Science from the US Naval Academy. He has summitted Kilimanjaro, ran with the Bulls in Pamplona, and hiked the Inca Trail.

Andy has worked at Frazier since 2016. After serving as a consultant on several successful investments, he joined the Frazier Growth Buyout team as a Center of Excellence Partner, where he has helped build our Human Capital and ESG programs. In 2022, Andy took on a broader mandate as the Chief Operating Officer of the Center of Excellence team. In this role, his responsibilities include the recruitment, management, and deployment of the firm’s Center of Excellence Team across our portfolio companies. He continues to shape our Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) program as well as other firm-level initiatives.

Founded in 1991, Frazier Healthcare Partners is a leading private equity firm focused exclusively on the healthcare sector. With over $7.1 billion in total capital raised, Frazier has invested in more than 200 companies with transaction types ranging from buyouts of profitable healthcare services companies to venture capital and company creation. Frazier has a philosophy of partnering with strong management teams while leveraging its internal operating resources and network to build exceptional companies. Frazier has offices in Seattle, WA, and Menlo Park, CA, and invests broadly across the U.S., Canada, and Europe. For more information about Frazier Healthcare Partners, visit www.frazierhealthcare.com.

Renée joined Norwest in 2022 as Operating Executive in the portfolio services team. With over 20 years of B2B marketing experience, she collaborates with company leaders to optimize and scale revenue engines for growth.

Previously, Renée was a senior vice president at Lucidworks, where she directed global strategy for brand, product marketing, demand generation, and sales development. Before that, she was a practice area leader at Trellist, a marketing consultancy and agency, where she launched the firm’s demand gen and social marketing practice, serving global Fortune 1000 and mid-market companies across a range of industries.

Renée’s career began in tech startups, where she gained extensive hands-on and strategic experience as a full-stack marketer and deep experience in marketing operations, digital marketing, and demand generation. She holds a bachelor of arts in political science and history with summa cum laude distinction from the University of Massachusetts.

Norwest is a leading venture and growth equity investment firm that works side-by-side with the world’s top entrepreneurs, empowering them throughout their personal journey of professional growth. Managing more than $15.5 billion in capital, we have invested in over 700 early-to-late-stage companies, with more than 230 currently active. Focused primarily on consumer, enterprise, and healthcare, we provide businesses with the specialized resources, expertise, guidance, and connections to achieve their vision. Norwest has offices in Menlo Park and San Francisco, with subsidiaries in India and Israel. To learn more, visit nvp.com.

Sean is an accomplished Cybersecurity professional with almost 30 years of experience leading Cybersecurity teams for Global consulting firms in the United States and Australia. Early on, he recognized the impact of ransomware and began helping the industry to acknowledge the importance of focusing on recovering business operations – not just determining the who and how.

A technologist with deep expertise in infrastructure and application security, Sean has designed, implemented and defended complex environments across most industries. He has also provided forensic analysis on complex breaches for both corporate and government agencies. In addition, he has developed a business acumen that stems from advising Private Equity firms on hundreds of complex mergers and acquisitions transactions in particular Cybersecurity firms and products.

This blend of skills has put Sean in the board room, supporting dozens of large organizations in the midst of a ransomware attack, and advising executives as they navigate their organization to recovery.

Enduir Cyber is the leading cybersecurity firm focused on Private Equity value creation.

In today’s market of fast paced transactions, cross industry investments, and a focus on technology enablement; Private Equity firms need a cybersecurity partner that understands the complexities of the M&A lifecycle.

Enduir’s Private Equity Portfolio Resilience (PEPR) Program™ delivers value from pre-close diligence all the way through sell-side preparation. We closely tailor each PEPR program with the Operating Partner to mitigate risk and build Portfolio cyber resilience throughout the investment period. When cyber incidents do occur, Enduir provides a white-glove Incident Command service to respond, recover, and get the PortCo back to business.

Amy serves as the EY Americas Private Equity Consulting leader helping Sponsors and Portfolio Companies develop and execute value creation strategies that deliver measurable results. She is also the Global Coordinating Partner for a Private Equity headquartered in New York and also serves as the Global Consulting leader for a leading global Private Equity complex.

Amy has more than 30 years of consulting and industry experience across the end-to-end deal lifecycle with focus on value creation – assisting Sponsors and their portfolio companies to unlock new revenue streams and deliver operational cost efficiencies that drive growth. She has supported strategic buy- and sell-side transactions and has led numerous initial public offerings. Amy has extensive experience with technology enabled business transformation, new business start-ups, and mid- and back- office optimization.

Prior to Ernst & Young, Amy held Finance and Operations leadership positions in Private Equity backed, highly acquisitive companies. She led initial public offerings, business unit carve-outs, and drove integration programs for multiple roll-ups. She also had responsibility for building go-to-market strategies and running optimized finance operations.

She earned her Bachelor of Science in Accounting degree from Lehigh University and her Master of Business Administration from Villanova University.

Dina DeMarco is an accomplished talent acquisition leader. She has held leadership roles in Talent Acquisition at the University of Chicago Medicine and Baptist Health of Florida. Her expertise extends to her tenure as SVP in Hueman's Recruitment Process Outsourcing division, where she developed recruitment strategies and delivery models for organizations in a variety of industries.

In 2020, Dina founded Hueman PE Talent Solutions, bringing both tactical and strategic talent acquisition solutions to PE-backed portfolio companies.

Dina's industry influence is underscored by her membership in the Forbes HR Council, a recognition of her thought leadership. Additionally, she has been recognized by HRO Today and has presented at numerous conferences.

Residing in Atlantic Beach, Florida, with her husband Jeff and rescue dog Buddy, Dina is involved in her community, previously serving on the board of several non-profits. In her leisure time, you will find Dina reading or playing soccer.

Recruitment should never hinder organizational growth. At Hueman PE Talent Solutions, we comprehend the rapid pace and high growth expectations for portfolio companies. We acknowledge that people are the driving force behind profits, and without effective recruitment, portfolio companies face obstacles in their growth journey.

By collaborating with Hueman PE Talent Solutions, private equity firms can mitigate investment risks and ensure that talent acquisition aligns with the VCP (Value Creation Plan). We offer portfolio companies access to top-notch recruitment resources at highly affordable rates, with an average placement fee of 9%. Our program is designed to be flexible, scalable, and results-oriented.

Hueman PE Talent Solutions emerged as a division of Hueman People Solutions in 2020, identifying a gap in recruitment solutions for rapidly expanding companies. While there are numerous executive search firms, there is a scarcity of good agencies focusing on crucial middle management and staff-level roles – and that's precisely where Hueman excels.

Cory A. Eaves is a Partner and Head of Portfolio Operations at BayPine, where he leads the firm’s digital transformation and portfolio operations team. BayPine is a pioneering new private equity firm—one built from the ground up to bring digital transformation to companies in the healthcare, consumer, business services, and specialty industrials industries. Cory’s primary focus is on driving digital transformation initiatives within the firm and its portfolio companies. Before joining BayPine in 2023, Cory was one of the first Operating Partners at General Atlantic, where he built and scaled their portfolio value-add capability for nearly 15 years. Before joining General Atlantic, he was Executive Vice President, Chief Technology Officer, and Chief Information Officer at Misys plc. Earlier in his career, Cory also served as Chief Technology Officer of SSA Global, one of the world’s largest enterprise software providers, and various other technology leadership positions. Outside of his professional endeavors, Cory is active in a number of philanthropic activities, including The Marfan Foundation, where he serves as past Chairman and board member, and NetHope, where he serves as Board Fellow. Outside of work, Cory spends his time off-shore sailboat racing, snowboarding, and with his family in Larchmont, New York.

BayPine is a newly-formed private equity firm that seeks to make control and control-oriented equity investments in high-quality, market-leading businesses in traditional industries with the intent of facilitating a comprehensive digital transformation. Headquartered in Boston, BayPine was founded to instill durable core-economy companies with the execution speed, innovation mindset and technology infrastructure of leading “new economy” businesses. At the heart of the strategy is a pointed focus on digital enablement, a purpose-built team of investors and operators, and a differentiated value creation playbook that operationalizes each company’s full potential. For more information on BayPine, please visit www.baypine.com.

Russ Findlay is a sales and marketing executive currently serving as a Senior Executive Director and Operating Partner for H.I.G Capital. where he focuses on marketing due diligence, value creation planning and portfolio company operations. Russ is responsible for helping portfolio companies develop and implement comprehensive digital and marketing strategies.

Russ has over 30 years of experience in a broad range of industries including CPG, Food & Beverage, Sports & Entertainment and Financial Services. Prior to joining H.I.G., Russ was the Global Chief Marketing Officer of international specialist insurer Hiscox. Before Hiscox, he was the Head of Marketing for IHOP, the CMO of Major League Soccer, and a marketing executive for PepsiCo, where he launched the Sierra Mist and PepsiMax brands. Russ started his career at Unilever where he was the global expert in e-commerce prior to roles in brand management.

Russ earned his M.B.A. from Xavier University, a B.S. in Marketing from State University of New York, Oswego and a Financial Technology Certificate from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.

H.I.G. Capital is a leading global alternative investment firm with $60 billion of capital under management.* Based in Miami, and with offices across the US and around the world, H.I.G. specializes in providing both debt and equity capital to middle market companies, utilizing a flexible and operationally focused/value-added approach across several funds including:

H.I.G.’s equity funds invest in management buyouts, recapitalizations and corporate carve-outs of both profitable as well as underperforming manufacturing and service businesses.

H.I.G.’s debt funds invest in senior, unitranche and junior debt financing to companies across the size spectrum, both on a primary (direct origination) basis, as well as in the secondary markets. H.I.G. also manages a publicly traded BDC, WhiteHorse Finance.

H.I.G.’s real estate funds invest in value-added properties, which can benefit from improved asset management practices.

H.I.G. Infrastructure focuses on making value-add and core plus investments in the infrastructure sector.

Since its founding in 1993, H.I.G. has invested in and managed more than 400 companies worldwide. The Firm’s current portfolio includes more than 100 companies with combined sales in excess of $53 billion.

Sam Foster is the founder of Pennant Partners, where he specializes in helping businesses and their owners to optimize for growth, enterprise value and to prepare for future exit strategies. Sam and Pennant do this work from various positions that range from pure advisory roles (advisory engagements, active Board roles, Operating Partner roles, etc.) to active investor/owners/co-owners with Pennant taking equity positions. With a career spanning nearly three decades, Sam has a deep background in the operation and financing of technology and industrial companies. His experience includes co-founding several venture capital firms in Boston, which have invested in a broad spectrum of businesses. As CEO, Sam has led various companies in sectors ranging from industrial manufacturing to healthcare and software-based technologies.

Sam's approach to business centers on team building, strategic innovation and revitalization, and improving sales and operations. His expertise lies not only in entrepreneurship and investment but also in the hands-on management of companies, aiming to create sustainable growth and operational excellence. In some instances, Pennant makes investments in or acquires businesses, utilizing the same networked experience, tools, and processes to generate growth and achieve excellent outcomes.

In addition to his work at Pennant Partners, Sam is actively involved in several other companies and non-profit organizations, leveraging his experience to support their growth and development.

Mr. Ganesan is a Managing Director within Oaktree Capital's Special Situation/Private Equity group. He specializes in driving commercial and operational performance improvement initiatives, including turnarounds, collaboratively with management teams. He joined Oaktree in 2017 from Yum! Brands, where he was the Vice President of Operations and corporate officer for the Taco-Bell division. He led operational and digital transformation of the 8,000 restaurant system. Prior thereto, he led Corporate & Business strategy and turnaround initiatives for both the Kimberly-Clark Corporation and Mattel, Inc. He was also an Engagement Manager with McKinsey & Company, where he served multiple Fortune 500 companies in the consumer, technology, manufacturing, medical devices, energy and financial sectors. Earlier in Mr. Ganesan’s career, he served as a 1st Lieutenant and field Artillery Officer of the Singapore Armed Forces. Mr. Ganesan received an M.B.A. from INSEAD Business School, a M.Sc. with highest distinction, and B.Sc. summa cum laude in mechanical engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, and Purdue University, respectively.

Oaktree is a leader among global investment managers specializing in alternative investments, with $156 billion in assets under management as of June 30, 2021. The firm emphasizes an opportunistic, value-oriented and risk-controlled approach to investments in credit, private equity, real assets and listed equities. The firm has over 1,000 employees and offices in 19 cities worldwide. For additional information, please visit Oaktree’s website at http://www.oaktreecapital.com/.

Giuseppe has extensive experience in the areas of assessment, design, and implementation of end-to-end business transformation programs, with a focus on software companies across all stages of development. His professional engagements have been with tech companies in the USA, Europe, and Asia. Giuseppe has worked on several company-led transformations as well as private-equity-driven transactions in the technology space. Clients benefit from his combination of deep industry knowledge, managerial skills, and business-oriented approach together with his technical expertise in financial modeling, software engineering, and organizational design. ​

​

Giuseppe has a master’s degree in telecommunication engineering from Sapienza University of Rome and an MBA from INSEAD.

AlixPartners is a results-driven global consulting firm that specializes in helping businesses respond quickly and decisively to their most critical challenges—from urgent performance improvement to complex restructuring, from risk mitigation to accelerated transformation. These are the moments when everything is on the line—a sudden shift in the market, an unexpected performance decline, a time-sensitive deal, a fork-in-the-road decision. We stand shoulder to shoulder with our clients until the job is done, and only measure our success in terms of the results we deliver. We partner with you to make the right decisions and take the right actions. And we are right by your side. When it really matters.

Rory’s professional credentials have been built entirely within financial services technology delivery. His work has primarily focused on offsetting the inefficiencies created by the increasing gap between supply & demand in technology talent markets.

Recognizing that great people are central to the best business outcomes, Rory harnesses his Psychology background to create and implement tailored people-led solutions for Private Equity firms and their portfolio companies. This produces qualitative and quantitative efficiencies to technology delivery capability.

Recognizing the inherently unique demands of each firm Rory has been central in defining Saragossa products & services extending to; Project based Consultancy, Search & Selection and IT offshoring.

With an uncompromising dedication to delivering clear quantifiable improvements to business outcomes Rory has established a reputation as the trusted advisor to Technology leaders globally.

Saragossa is a Technology Solutions organisation with a proven track supporting Private Equity businesses, accelerating their portfolio companies. For nearly a decade we have provided support leading Private Equity organisations to maximise returns through rapid, specialised technology solutions. Providing strategic support alongside all of our core services: Project Delivery Consulting, Technology Outsourcing, Staffing, Executive Search, and 3rd party Talent Acquisition.

Having developed a reputation for unparalleled Private Equity domain expertise, we fully grasp the unique challenges presented managing an evolving technology business portfolio, responding rapidly to changing priorities and goals in a fiercely competitive landscape.

Our core values; Fearless, Uncompromising and Human underpin everything we do. We are brave, working outside of conventional methods to achieve agreed objectives, we do not compromise in our commitment to creating brilliant customer experiences, believing that great people are at the heart of every successful outcome.

Angela is the Head of Human Capital and member of the Investment Committee at GrowthCurve Capital, where she partners with the Investment team to accelerate growth through talent and organizational design. Angela’s role focuses on assessing organizations upfront to create a blueprint for value creation, developing a bespoke organizational development strategy, and seeking to drive continuous improvement within GrowthCurve’s portfolio companies. Before joining GrowthCurve in 2022, Angela was the Chief Human Resources Officer at Sun Capital Partners, where she worked across a diverse portfolio driving human capital initiatives. Before joining private equity, Angela held several global Human Resources leadership positions at JLL, Kellogg Company, and Procter & Gamble, working in both the U.S. and Europe. Angela brings a wealth of data analytics, assessment, recruiting, talent management, and leadership development expertise from her prior experience and education. Angela earned a Master and Ph.D. in Industrial-Organizational Psychology from Wayne State University and a Bachelor of Arts degree from Kalamazoo College.

GrowthCurve Capital is a private equity firm with a proprietary approach that seeks to leverage AI, digital transformation, and human capital capabilities within its portfolio companies to accelerate their growth and create sustainable value. We believe AI provides unique opportunities to unlock new areas of value creation within our portfolio companies by enhancing their operational decision-making at scale. Together with a differentiated approach to human capital, we believe this ecosystem empowers management teams to create sustainable value.

GrowthCurve’s control-oriented investment strategy is centered on data-rich and growth-focused businesses in three investing sectors where we have deep expertise and strong networks: technology and information services, healthcare, and financial services.

Mr. Giraldo is a Partner with TPG Growth and TPG Rise in San Francisco. As a member of the Business Building team, he focuses his time on consumer goods, retail, the circular economy and ed-tech. Prior to joining TPG, Ignacio worked in management consulting, finance, startups and the corporate world, including Monitor Company, Goldman Sachs, MercadoLibre, Diageo, SABMiller, and Nike. Ignacio holds Bachelor's degrees in Industrial Engineering and Mathematics from Universidad de los Andes in Bogota, Colombia, and an MBA from the Stanford University Graduate School of Business.

Founded in San Francisco in 1992, TPG has a long history of investing in change, growth, and innovation through a platform that spans private equity, public equity, real estate, and impact investing. TPG now has approximately $85 billion under management with investment and operational teams in 14 offices around the world. For more information, please visit www.tpg.com or follow us on Twitter @TPG

Josh has over 20 years of experience helping some of the most innovative, disruptive tech companies and established market leaders accelerate profitable growth (e.g. LinkedIn, Adobe, Zendesk, UKG, Cisco, PayPal, LegalZoom, PTC, NXP, Ancestry.com). As a Senior Operating Executive at H&F, Josh partners with boards of directors and C-level executives to drive enterprise-wide transformation and value creation at portfolio companies. Prior to H&F, Josh held executive roles at Adobe and LinkedIn focused on business strategy, product marketing, and go-to-market. Previously, he spent 10 years in management consulting, including six years as a leader in Simon-Kucher’s technology practice. Josh holds a B.S. from the Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania and an M.A. from Johns Hopkins University.

Hellman & Friedman is a global private equity firm focused on large-scale equity investments in high quality growth businesses. H&F partners with world-class management teams where its deep sector expertise, long-term orientation and collaborative partnership approach enable companies to flourish. Since its founding in 1984, H&F has invested in over 100 companies and currently has $120 billion in asset under management.

Scott Graham is an Operating Partner at Diversis Capital and an expert on growth and marketing strategy.

He supports Diversis's B2B and B2C portfolio companies in building and executing their go-to-market strategies and designing brands, experiences, and campaigns to grow their customers and revenues. Scott helps operating teams develop customer-centric, data-driven best practices that leverage cross-collaboration, rapid iteration, and continuous discovery methodologies. Often taking on the role of leader-coach alongside operating teams, he leverages his technical and operational competencies to be a hands-on leader across a wide range of domains including campaign design, messaging, creative direction, market research, data analysis, SEO, automation, web development, CRO and UX.

Throughout his career, he has consulted and led product, marketing, and growth teams for a wide range of technology companies including operating as VP of Product & Marketing at Carjojo, Co-Founder & COO of CommonGenuis, and VP of Marketing at Pinger. Scott was recognized by TechCrunch in 2021 as a top growth expert and is a frequent guest lecturer and a key contributor to the Growth Hacking curriculum at Berkeley's Haas School of Business. He also serves as a growth advisor for Carnegie Mellon's VentureBridge program, where he has helped consumer, textile, AR/VR, and travel industry companies hone their brands, products, and go-to-market strategies. Scott holds an MBA from the University of California, Berkeley Haas School of Business and a BBA with triple majors in Marketing, Finance, and Entrepreneurship from Emory University, Goizueta Business School.

Diversis is a software and technology focused private equity fund that invests in lower middle-market companies, targeting situations where it can add unique value in helping a company reach the next level. With a collaborative approach to investing, its Operating Partners and Strategic Advisors work alongside management teams to help build successful organizations positioned for long-term growth.

Andrea Greene is a senior executive, board member and investor with more than 25 years of experience leading organizations and profitably growing businesses. As an Operating Partner at One Rock Capital, Andrea works with the firm’s portfolio companies on value creation initiatives primarily in the finance and human resources functions. These are the moments when everything is on the line – a sudden shift in the market, an unexpected performance decline, a time-sensitive deal, a fork-in-the-road decision. But it’s not what we do that makes a difference, it’s how we do it.

Tackling situations when time is of the essence is part of our DNA – so we adopt an action-oriented approach at all times. About Bain Capital:
